translated: The Discussion of the Attainment of Cessation
Is the attainment of cessation unformed?

original: Nibbānaṁ tāṇaṁ leṇaṁ saraṇaṁ parāyanaṁ accutaṁ amatanti?
analyzed: nibbānam tāṇam leṇam saraṇam parāyanam accutam
translated: “Is Nibbāna the refuge, the haven, the island, the shelter, the resort, the true friend, the true support, the true destination?”
“Is the attainment of cessation unformed, and is Nibbāna unformed?”

original: Atthi keci nirodhaṁ samāpajjanti paṭilabhanti uppādenti samuppādenti uṭṭhapenti samuṭṭhapenti nibbattenti abhinibbattenti janenti sañjanentīti?
analyzed: atthi keci nirodham samāpajjanti paṭilabhanti uppādenti samuppādenti uṭṭhapenti samuṭṭhapenti nibbattenti abhinibbattenti janenti sañjanenti iti
translated: “Are there any who enter upon the attainment of cessation, who attain it, who arise from it, who produce it, who are intent upon it, who have entered upon it, who have attained it, who have arisen from it?”

original: Atthi keci asaṅkhataṁ samāpajjanti paṭilabhanti uppādenti samuppādenti uṭṭhapenti samuṭṭhapenti nibbattenti abhinibbattenti janenti sañjanentīti?
analyzed: atthi keci asaṅkhatam samāpajjanti paṭilabhanti uppādenti samuppādenti uṭṭhapenti samuṭṭhapenti nibbattenti abhinibbattenti janenti sañjanenti iti
translated: “Are there any who enter upon the unformed, who attain it, who arise from it, who produce it, who are intent upon it, who have entered upon it, who have attained it, who have arisen from it?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Then is it not said that purification is known, that emergence is known?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: nirodhaṁ samāpajjantassa paṭhamaṁ nirujjhati vacīsaṅkhāro, tato kāyasaṅkhāro, tato cittasaṅkhāroti?
analyzed: nirodham samāpajjantassa paṭhamam nirujjhati vacī saṅkhāro tato kāya saṅkhāro tato citta saṅkhāro ti
translated: “When one attains cessation, is it the case that first the volitional formations of speech cease, then the volitional formations of the body cease, then the volitional formations of the mind cease?”

original: Asaṅkhataṁ samāpajjantassa paṭhamaṁ nirujjhati vacīsaṅkhāro, tato kāyasaṅkhāro, tato cittasaṅkhāroti?
analyzed: asaṅkhatam samāpajjantassa paṭhamam nirujjhati vacī saṅkhāro tato kāya saṅkhāro tato citta saṅkhāro ti
translated: “When one attains the unformed, is it the case that first the volitional formations of speech cease, then the volitional formations of the body cease, then the volitional formations of the mind cease?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa paṭhamaṁ uppajjati cittasaṅkhāro, tato kāyasaṅkhāro, tato vacīsaṅkhāroti?
analyzed: nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa paṭhamam uppajjati citta saṅkhāro tatas kāya saṅkhāro tatas vacī saṅkhāro ti
translated: “When one emerges from cessation, is it the case that first the volitional formations of the mind arise, then the volitional formations of the body arise, then the volitional formations of speech arise?”

original: Asaṅkhatā vuṭṭhahantassa paṭhamaṁ uppajjati cittasaṅkhāro, tato kāyasaṅkhāro, tato vacīsaṅkhāroti?
analyzed: asaṅkhatā vuṭṭhahantassa paṭhamam uppajjati citta saṅkhāro tatas kāya saṅkhāro tatas vacī saṅkhāro ti
translated: “When one emerges from the unformed, is it the case that first the volitional formations of the mind arise, then the volitional formations of the body arise, then the volitional formations of speech arise?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“When one has emerged from cessation, is it the case that three kinds of contact touch him—

original: suññato phasso, animitto phasso, appaṇihito phassoti?
analyzed: suññataḥ phassaḥ animittaḥ phassaḥ appaṇihitaḥ phassoti

translated: When one has emerged from the unconditioned, are the three kinds of contact contacted:

original: suññato phasso, animitto phasso, appaṇihito phassoti?
analyzed: suññataḥ phassaḥ animittaḥ phassaḥ appaṇihitaḥ phassoti

original: Nirodhā vuṭṭhitassa vivekaninnaṁ cittaṁ hoti vivekapoṇaṁ vivekapabbhāranti?
analyzed: nirodhā vuṭṭhitassa viveka ninnam cittam hoti viveka poṇam viveka pabbhāranti
translated: “When one has emerged from cessation, is his mind inclined to seclusion, bent on seclusion, and released towards seclusion?”

original: Asaṅkhatā vuṭṭhitassa vivekaninnaṁ cittaṁ hoti vivekapoṇaṁ vivekapabbhāranti?
analyzed: asaṅkhatā vuṭṭhitassa viveka ninnam cittam hoti viveka poṇam viveka pabbhāranti
translated: “When one has emerged from the unconditioned, is his mind inclined to seclusion, bent on seclusion, and released towards seclusion?”
that the attainment of cessation is unconditioned.”

analyzed: tena hi nirodha samāpatti asaṅkhatā ati
translated: “Then the attainment of cessation is unconditioned.”
The discussion of the attainment of cessation is finished.
